content.description: Two resistors with resistances <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>R</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 R" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math> and two uncharged capacitors with capacitances <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>C</mi> </math> and <math alttext="2 C" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi>C</mi></math> are connected to a battery with <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>, as shown.
content.question: Which of the following is equal to the time constant <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math> of the circuit?
